channel.title: Ideas for improving server status page
channel.description:
These are my current ideas to improve the page:
[ol][li]Server Status Control Panel, This would show you things like: [list type=decimal] [li]Last time the server was checked[/li] [li]Any errors given while checking to see if it was online, like DNS didn't resolve, connection timed out, connection refused, etc etc[/li] [li]Any future enhancements, like page impressions on your ad, time people played your server with moparscape, etc[/li] [/list][/li]
[li]New online checking program, with a longer timeout than the current one, which should report online more consistently even with network traffic. This could also: [list type=decimal] [li]Send you an email (which you could forward to a text message) when your server is offline, with the error returned[/li] [li]Check servers that came up offline once more after all others have been checked, this would give them another chance of not being 'offline' with no decrease in uptime. Still not sure about this one, comment.[/li] [/list][/li] [li]Dynamic DNS for ss.moparisthebest.com, this would allow you as a server owner, instead of using a no-ip, you could have <whatever-name-you-choose>.ss.moparisthebest.com point to your server, and update it with the same type of client that you use for no-ip. Would you use that?[/li] [li]Much more integration with your site, could include: [list type=decimal] [li]Registration callback page. You put a link to a page on your server on the 'edit server' page, this page implements an API so that users can register for your server from a page on moparisthebest.com, my server tells your server about it and your server tells my server whether it is accepted or denied with a reason.[/li] [li]Vote callback page. You put a link to a page on your server on the 'edit server' page, this page implements an API so that my server can tell it what users voted on your server, along with info you need so that you can track which users voted on your website. You can offer rewards for votes, or any number of other things with this.[/li] [li]Perhaps I can implement an OpenID system, so that people can register on your website simply with their moparscape forums user/pass, or maybe even just log in with this, so they have the same login across all servers[/li] [li]MoparScape ad revenue share. Allow your users to play your server using moparscape, and you get multiple advantages: [list type=decimal] [li]You put your google adsense code in your 'edit server' page, and something like 50% of the time (negotiable), when people play your server using moparscape, I will display ads with your code (that YOU get paid for) instead of my ads.[/li] [li]Users are comfortable playing moparscape, it is a familiar interface, and they know their computer is safe from malware and viruses if they do so[/li] [li]Your server can automatically be played by ALL systems, people running Linux, Mac OSX, or Windows, with the same client[/li] [li]MoparScape supports custom clients as well (you can write a modified client to run inside moparscape, much easier than writing your own web client), and soon HD clients that are also cross-platform[/li] [li]You don't have to worry about legal problems associated with hosting the client[/li] [/list][/li] [/list][/li][/ol]
And if your server supports full integration (registration callback if registration is required, and allows people to play on the moparscape client) then you will be rewarded with a better position on the server status page, an official 'moparscape approved' status, and possibly more. In the future, I will probably require ALL sponsored servers to support full integration, and may even require ALL servers to support it, but that's quite a ways down the line.
Please comment on all of these as to whether you would use them, or support them, or change them somehow. Or add in your own feature requests. When you are referencing one of the ideas, please use a format like 3.1.4 (this would be referring to the line about MoparScape supporting custom clients)
Thanks for helping to improve this!

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

That would work i guess. Also would there possibly be the option to use our own status image?

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Or I guess it could just be an argument to the page, like so:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus/textout.php?server=00.000.00.00&online=this server is online!&offline=boohoo, we are offline…
so:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus/textout.php?server=00.000.00.00&online=this%20server%20is%20online!&offline=boohoo,%20we%20are%20offline…

How about that?

Read full topic
item.source: Ideas for improving server status page

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Possibly an option on our server status insert/edit page where we select the font family, size & colour and then it loads from a databse then gets displayed?

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:37, topic:373011”]Well im no PHP guru or anything, But perhaps something like an iframe perhaps? say something like moparscape server hosts a PHP page with cases for each server
like moparisthebest.com/serverstatus/textout.php?=00.000.00.00 then maybe get the data somehow from your page, only way i can think is an iframe or similar from the top of my head.[/quote]

An iframe would work of course, but you don’t get any control over what the text actually says, or colors or anything like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:35, topic:373011”]Possibly the ability to display server status as text, i know we spoke in PM’s about this and you showed me how to resize the image, But personally i think the ability to show text would be very helpful.

such as: 00.000.00.00 is currently online

Or something like, that, yes an image is nice but text can be minipulated in many more ways and then styled by our own css the way us server owners would like it.[/quote]

Someone asked me that before, I think it was you. My question is how would that ever be implemented? My only idea on that would be javascript code on your website that queries my server with AJAX to see whether it is online or not, then you print out whatever you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

deathschaos9:

Wouldn’t bother me one bit. Another thing that might be useful would be preventing members from registering servers on port 80.

What’s wrong with port 80? They can be hosted on port 80 as well. Port redirects?

What about no-ip redirects. I’m sure many start out with a hostname that redirects to a big static IP’ed server. Isn’t that also “cheating”?

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Judging by the latest threads in this section, a feature people would like to use would be the ability to change their own IP. I would only allow this if both domain names resolved to the same IP, so you couldn’t change it to another server. The odd part about this is the domain name is in the URL of the page, so all links to your server status page would be changed, does that bother anyone?

Read full topic
item.source: Ideas for improving server status page

item.dc:creator: @mr_dope mr dope
item.description:

I think the ideas are really great, but I wouldn’t know how to implement most of the links between you and my server.

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m telling you those are already done, you just click the top of the column that you want to sort by:

new:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=time&desc
old:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=time
downtime:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=uptime
uptime:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=uptime&desc
least votes:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=vote
most votes:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=vote&desc
317:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=version
508:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=version&desc

Do you see what I mean now? Also, if you didn’t see it from the beginning, how can I make it clearer you can click the headers of the table?

Read full topic
item.source: Ideas for improving server status page

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Well then I like lothys idea, and I thought it was only online/offline so my bad. Perhaps you could also make it like sort all, sort new, sort old, sort offline, sort downtime/uptime, sort votes, sort 317, and sort 508. And ofc the premium servers would be uptop. Either that or lothys idea would work.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @chaoticxx chaoticxx
item.description:
@chaoticxx wrote:

[quote=“Fanz, post:25, topic:373011”]That’s true…
How about this…
If a server has been up for 150 days and has 7 days of downtime it would count as a 143.
And another server that has been up for 145 days and 1 day of downtime would be a 144.

So do it that way?[/quote]

Ok, so if anyone wants to begin his server, then he have 1 day uptime… Then he is on the last page… Thats an horriible idea because then u have to wait 3-4 months to get to first page?..

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Fanz:

Just make it based on the date that the server was registered instead of uptime.

But then an old server with 52% uptime would be up top, above a server registered one day later with 99% uptime, that wouldn’t be fair would it?

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s an interesting idea. I’ll try to play around with it to see how it works. I’ve always wanted to take into account how long a server has been registered, but couldn’t think up a really good system.

Read full topic
item.source: Ideas for improving server status page

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Any ideas on how I would implement that though?

Award an ‘uptime’ point each time that your probe discovers that the server is online. Award a ‘downtime’ point if the server is down when you probe it.

Then calculate a score, perhaps using uptime_points / downtime_points.
So a server that has 500 uptime points and 7 downtime points would score 71 (71.42 rounded down), and a server that has 500 uptime points and 150 downtime points would score 3.

The scoring formula doesn’t really matter, so long as you apply it consistently across the board. You could take other metrics into consideration, such as server longevity… but the point system effectively does this in my opinion.

Read full topic
item.source: Ideas for improving server status page

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

item.title: Ideas for improving server status page
item.dc:creator: @James_Akins James_Akins
item.description:
@James_Akins wrote:

[quote=“Travis_02, post:18, topic:373011”][quote author=Fanz link=topic=469032.msg3456602#msg3456602 date=1294087921]
Maybe switch online servers to uptime as a server that opened 6 months ago with 98% status is probably a lot more reliable to still be there the next month than a new server that was released 2 days ago with 100%.

The uptime will show the amount of time that the server has been online for and beside it the amount of downtime. The server that has been online for the longest stays at the top. New severs that won’t be online next week seem to be getting a lot more players as they get the “Front page”.
[/quote]

Like an overall average for uptime? I think that’d be great.[/quote]
This.

Read full topic
